items.sentence: Difficult problems require imaginative solutions.
Some people still believe that the world is flat.
I could no longer pretend that I wasn\'t in pain.
I didn\'t buy it because it was really expensive.
Tom is good at golf, but not very good at tennis.
Tom is the only one who can answer that question.
Tom is the only one with the key to this cabinet.
Tom knew Mary had studied French for three years.
Tom knows Mary better than anyone else here does.
Tom lives in a house that was built in the 1700s.
I don\'t think either of us wants that to happen.
I don\'t think this shirt goes with that red tie.
I don\'t understand a word of what Tom is saying.
I guess that\'s just the way the cookie crumbles.
I want to eat some Korean food that isn\'t spicy.
I want you to understand what I\'m trying to say.
Here. Take this with you. It might come in handy.
Excuse me, could you pass me the salt and pepper?
I always have a couple of beach towels in my car.
When did Tom tell you that you needed to do that?
